page.html:
Overview of My Role at Robert Half as a Marketing Web Developer

As a marketing web developer at Robert Half, I was pivotal in managing and enhancing the company's digital content ecosystem using Adobe Experience Manager (AEM). My responsibilities extended beyond content authoring, including collaborating across teams, optimizing workflows, and leveraging advanced tools to streamline processes. My work directly impacted the efficiency, quality, and scalability of Robert Half's efficiency and delivery.

Key Achievements

  1. Streamlined Bulk Content Updates Using ACS Commons Tools:

    • Mastered using ACS AEM Commons tools such as the Data Importer and Content Fragment Importer, significantly reducing time spent on large-scale data and content updates.

    • Enabled mass importing of SEO metadata, blog tags, and Experience Fragments through Excel, improving consistency and accuracy across global campaigns.

    • Documented workflows and findings for team-wide knowledge sharing, optimizing processes for current and future tasks.

  2. Enhanced Workflow Efficiency:

    • Conducted in-depth research on AEM tools and techniques to maximize bulk updates and automate repetitive tasks.

    • Reduced task completion times by more than half, ensuring projects met tight deadlines without compromising quality.

    • Provided debugging and issue resolution using ACS AEM Tooling, improving system reliability.

  3. Global Marketing Campaign Support:

    • Collaborated with designers, developers, and international teams to ensure content adhered to branding guidelines, SEO standards, and accessibility best practices.

    • Supported component updates based on global user research, aligning marketing efforts with data-driven insights.

    • Managed marketing campaigns, component creation, and updates using tools like

      Jira, Excel, Figma, Storybook, and MS Teams

      .

  4. Content Quality Assurance and Organization:

    • Regularly tested and optimized content to ensure flawless performance across various devices and platforms.

    • Identified and documented design, component, and CMS bugs, creating detailed

      Jira tickets to guide resolution efforts.

    • Developed, organized, and transferred copy and data into AEM components, ensuring seamless integration with marketing strategies.

  5. Optimized Redirect Management:

    • Led redirect management starting in phase one of the project using the ACS Redirect Manager, improving the efficiency of handling large-scale redirects.

    • Successfully improved the mass updating of status codes and collaborated on strategies to reduce redirect chains.

    • Resolved indexing issues in lower environments, ensuring accurate and efficient search engine crawling.

Responsibilities in AEM Development

  • Authored and managed content within Adobe Experience Manager, ensuring a consistent and efficient user experience.

  • Utilized Advanced Tool Kits that leveraged both Data API and Spreadsheet API

    for large-scale data handling, including SEO metadata updates and experience fragment imports.

  • Worked closely with SEO, marketing, design, and front-end development teams to deliver content aligned with business goals.

  • Conducted ongoing system testing, troubleshooting, and process improvement initiatives to support a robust AEM ecosystem.

Impact and Skills

During my time at Robert Half as a Marketing Web Developer, I showcased my capability to produce top-tier content and enhance operational efficiency using innovative AEM tools. I developed strong communication and organizational skills while overseeing cross-functional collaborations and elements of global campaigns. My accomplishments reflect my commitment to crafting scalable and impactful solutions within a fast-moving digital landscape.
